questions.question: You can create a dynamic workspace by using the Generate Workspace dialog or by changing feature type parameters.
Checking Merge Feature Types parameter on a reader feature type is similar - but not exactly the same - as choosing Single Merged Feature Type in Workflow Options when adding a reader.
In which of the following scenarios should you use Automatic mode for Feature Type Definition when adding a writer?
options: You are authoring a workspace that makes an API call to retrieve data. You do not expect to receive the same schema each time. You would like to write out the results, regardless of schema, to your destination.
You are authoring a workspace that makes an API call to retrieve data. You expect to receive the same schema each time and want it to be mirrored in your destination dataset.

You are authoring a workspace that makes an API call to retrieve data. You expect to receive the same schema each time, but you don't know what it is before authoring and would like to customize it using an AttributeManager before writing.
You are authoring a workspace that makes an API call to retrieve data. You expect to receive the same schema each time. You have to modify the incoming schema to fit an existing schema.

questions.question: In which of the following scenarios should you use Dynamic (Advanced) mode for Feature Type Definition when adding a writer?
options: You are authoring a workspace that makes an API call to retrieve data. You do not expect to receive the same schema each time. You would like to write out the results, regardless of schema, to your destination.
You are authoring a workspace that makes an API call to retrieve data. You expect to receive the same schema each time and want it to be mirrored in your destination dataset.

You are authoring a workspace that makes an API call to retrieve data. You expect to receive the same schema each time, but you don't know what it is before authoring and would like to customize it using an AttributeManager before writing.
You are authoring a workspace that makes an API call to retrieve data. You expect to receive the same schema each time. You have to modify the incoming schema to fit an existing schema.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true about the difference between Automatic and Dynamic Feature Type Definition Mode on writer feature types in FME?
options: Automatic attributes are defined based on the source data, while dynamic attributes are defined based on whatever is connected to them.
Dynamic attributes are defined based on the source data, while automatic attributes are defined based on whatever is connected to them.
Automatic attributes are defined manually, while dynamic attributes are defined based on the source data.
Dynamic attributes are defined based on whatever source data gets read, regardless of what is connected to them, while automatic attributes are defined based on the source data.
